title: Inquest opened into death of former Liverpool Women manager
body_text:
An inquest has opened into the death of former Liverpool Womenâ€™s manager, Matthew Beard.
Mr Beard, of Green Meadows, Hawarden, died aged 47 at the Countess of Chester Hospital, on September 20.
At County Hall in Ruthin on Monday (September 29), an inquest was opened into his death by John Gittins, senior coroner for North Wales east and central.
Mr Beard was a professional football coach and manager, who had previously led Liverpool to two Women's Super League titles.
The inquest opening heard Mr Beard suffered an out-of-hospital cardiac arrest, secondary to hanging.
CPR was conducted and he was taken to the intensive care unit at the Countess of Chester Hospital with a "devastating" brain injury.
A medical cause of death was given as hypoxic brain injury.
The full inquest into Mr Beard's death was adjourned until a later date.
